subject: Career
title: The Bystander Effect in Workplace Misconduct
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Bystander Effect in Workplace Misconduct.

hook.text: Everyone sees the bullying. Nobody speaks up. Each person assumes someone else will act. Nobody does.

buildup.text: The bystander effect: the more witnesses, the less likely any individual is to intervene.

discovery.text: Darley and LatanÃ© demonstrated this in 1968. Diffusion of responsibility paralyzes entire groups.

twist.text: In workplaces, the bystander effect is amplified by fear of retaliation and career consequences.

climax.text: Breaking the cycle requires one person to act. Report it. Name it. Once one speaks, others follow.

punchline.text: Silence isn't neutrality. In toxicity, silence is complicity.

quiz.question: What is the bystander effect in workplaces?
options: The more witnesses, the less likely anyone intervenes
